name: Name
mcp_switch_config_description: Customize the location of MCP Switch configuration (e.g., set to a cloud synced folder).
config_override_description: Manually specify config paths for editors like Claude Code or Codex (useful for WSL).
window_behavior_desc: Configure window minimization and tray behavior.
minimize_to_tray_desc: Hide to system tray when closing the window.
claude_cli_hint: MCP added via Claude CLI is project-level by default
project_config_tooltip:
Claude Code supports two ways to configure project-level MCP:
1. Configure in .mcp.json file under the project directory (recommended)
2. Configure project-specific MCP servers in global ~/.claude.json (legacy way)
cursor_edit_hint: Please edit Cursor config in its client interface
terminal_active_task_warning: Active terminal task detected. Please exit manually before closing.
add_marketplace_desc: Select an official or community marketplace to add
error_rate_limit: Too many requests, please try again later
deepl_api_key_desc: Will be used as backup engine when built-in engines fail
marketplace_hint_claude_code: Built-in plugins for Claude Code CLI
marketplace_hint_agent_skills: Official document processing skills, the underlying implementation of Claude's document capabilities
marketplace_hint_superpowers: Complete developer workflow skills covering testing, debugging, collaboration and more
marketplace_hint_gmickel: Flow-Next plan-first workflows, Ralph autonomous overnight coding mode
marketplace_hint_awesome: Comprehensive curated list of community slash commands and MCP servers
marketplace_hint_madappgang: Battle-tested multi-agent coordination patterns from 100+ days production use
community_resources_desc: Discover more skills and marketplaces from the community
custom_skill_install_desc: Enter a GitHub URL containing SKILL.md to install
gemini_custom_skill_desc: Install skill from GitHub to ~/.gemini/skills/ directory
antigravity_custom_skill_desc: Install skill from GitHub to ~/.gemini/antigravity/skills/ directory
github_url_tooltip: Make sure the directory contains a SKILL.md file
skill_name_hint: Enter a name for this skill
skill_security_warning: Installing skills from unknown sources may pose security risks. Only install skills from trusted sources.
skill_copied_hint: Command copied! Use it in Claude Code CLI or VSCode-CC extension

confirm_delete_skill_content: Are you sure you want to delete skill "{name}"? This action cannot be undone.
confirm_remove_marketplace_content: Are you sure you want to remove marketplace "{name}"? Installed plugins will not be deleted.
custom_marketplace_hint: e.g. wshobson/agents or /plugin marketplace add wshobson/agents
available_plugins_hint: Claude Code supports bundling multiple skills into a plugin for distribution
claude_api_key_desc: Required for AI assistant feature, needs Anthropic API Key
claude_api_key_required: Please configure Claude API Key in settings first
claude_api_base_url_desc: For third-party proxies, leave empty for official API. Try ending with /api or /api/v1 if not working
claude_model_desc: Select Claude model. Choose available model if API Key has restrictions
chatbot_placeholder: Ask me anything about plugins, skills, MCP...
chatbot_hint: I can help you manage plugins, marketplaces, skills and MCP configurations
ai_chatbot_section_desc: Configure Claude API to enable AI assistant features
clear_history_confirm: Are you sure you want to clear all chat history?
claude_settings_no_env: No env field in settings file
claude_settings_empty: No API settings found in Claude config
claude_not_installed_message: Claude Code CLI is not detected on your system. You need to install Claude CLI to use plugin management and Skills features.
copy_command_hint: If automatic installation fails, you can copy the command below and run it manually in the corresponding terminal.
claude_path_not_configured_message: Claude CLI is installed but not added to the system PATH environment variable. Click below to configure automatically.
claude_path_configured_success: PATH configured successfully! Please restart the app for changes to take effect
select_shell_desc: Choose a shell for the built-in terminal. PowerShell is recommended for better compatibility.
powershell_desc: Modern shell with full ANSI support, better for interactive CLI tools
shell_change_hint: You can change this later in Settings > Advanced
shell_change_restart_hint: Shell changed, please reopen terminal to take effect
codex_not_installed_message: Codex CLI is not detected on your system. You need Node.js and npm to install Codex CLI.
codex_copy_command_hint: Run this command in your terminal to install Codex CLI.
gemini_not_installed_message: Gemini CLI is not detected on your system. You need Node.js and npm to install Gemini CLI.
gemini_copy_command_hint: Run this command in your terminal to install Gemini CLI.
codex_install_command_copied: Install command copied. Run it in a Codex session
codex_delete_skill_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete skill "{name}"? This cannot be undone.
codex_custom_skill_desc: Install Skill from GitHub to ~/.codex/skills/ directory
gemini_skills_tooltip:
As of 2026.1.19, Gemini CLI Agent Skills is still experimental and needs to be enabled manually

1. Install nightly version:
npm install -g @google/gemini-cli@nightly

2. Enable Skills feature:
Enter Gemini CLI, type /settings, enable experimental.skills

Gemini CLI discovers Skills from:
• Project level: .gemini/skills/
• User level: ~/.gemini/skills/
• Extension level: via extensions install (supported)

gemini_delete_extension_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete extension "{name}"? This cannot be undone.
